title: [V1] Find out if you can get a criminal records check for a role you're recruiting for

body.content:
You can only check someone's criminal record if they're applying for certain roles. Find out if you can get a [Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check](/disclosure-barring-service-check) for a job you're recruiting for.

^DBS checks used to be known as Criminal Records Bureau (CRB) checks.^ 

If you're applying for a job, you can’t get a DBS check for yourself. Instead, request a ‘basic disclosure’ from [Disclosure Scotland](http://www.disclosurescotland.co.uk/basicdisclosureonline/index.htm) (you don't have to be from Scotland).

##Roles that aren't covered
This tool doesn't cover roles in the armed forces.  


*[DBS]: Disclosure and Barring Service
*[CRB]: Criminal Record Bureau

nodes.title: Adopting or fostering children

body.content:
You’ll need a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check if you’re adopting or fostering children, or you’re a back up foster carer. 

Some members of your household might also need checks. 

##If you’re adopting

You'll need an [enhanced check](/disclosure-barring-service-check) and [children’s barred list check](/disclosure-barring-service-check/dbs-barred-lists).

The agency can also get an [enhanced check](/disclosure-barring-service-check) and [children’s barred list check](/disclosure-barring-service-check/dbs-barred-lists) for anyone over 18 that you live with. 

The adoption agency will usually arrange the checks for you and the people you live with. 

##If you’re fostering

You’ll need an [enhanced check](/disclosure-barring-service-check) and a [children’s barred list check](/disclosure-barring-service-check/dbs-barred-lists) if you’re either:

- a foster parent or carer
- a private foster parent or carer

The agency can also get an [enhanced check](/disclosure-barring-service-check) and [children’s barred list check](/disclosure-barring-service-check/dbs-barred-lists) for anyone over 16 that you live with. 

The fostering agency will usually arrange the checks for you and the people you live with. 

##If you’re a back up foster carer 

^A back up foster carer is a person who the main foster carer nominates to occasionally care for children.^

If you’ll be unsupervised when caring for the children, the agency can get an [enhanced check](/disclosure-barring-service-check) and a [children’s barred list check](/disclosure-barring-service-check/dbs-barred-lists) on you.

If you’ll be supervised when caring for the children, the agency can get an [enhanced check](/disclosure-barring-service-check) on you. 

The fostering agency will usually arrange the checks.

^You might not have checks done for you if you’re only occasionally caring for children - contact the fostering agency to find out more.^

*[DBS]: Disclosure and Barring Service

You’ll need a Disclosure and Barring Service (DBS) check if you’re adopting or fostering children, or you’re a back up foster carer.

Some members of your household might also need checks.

If you’re adopting

You’ll need an enhanced check and children’s barred list check.

The agency can also get an enhanced check and children’s barred list check for anyone over 18 that you live with.

The adoption agency will usually arrange the checks for you and the people you live with.

If you’re fostering

You’ll need an enhanced check and a children’s barred list check if you’re either:

  • a foster parent or carer
  • a private foster parent or carer

The agency can also get an enhanced check and children’s barred list check for anyone over 16 that you live with.

The fostering agency will usually arrange the checks for you and the people you live with.

If you’re a back up foster carer

A back up foster carer is a person who the main foster carer nominates to occasionally care for children.

If you’ll be unsupervised when caring for the children, the agency can get an enhanced check and a children’s barred list check on you.

If you’ll be supervised when caring for the children, the agency can get an enhanced check on you.

The fostering agency will usually arrange the checks.

You might not have checks done for you if you’re only occasionally caring for children - contact the fostering agency to find out more.

nodes.title: You can request an enhanced check with a children's barred list check

body.content:
Being a childminder is [‘regulated activity’](/government/publications/dbs-check-eligible-positions-guidance), which means people barred from working with children can't do this role. 

For childminders you can get: 

+ an [enhanced check](/disclosure-barring-service-check) 
+ a [children’s barred list check](/disclosure-barring-service-check/dbs-barred-lists) 

##People who live or work with the childminder
You can also request these checks for anyone 16 or over who lives with a childminder or works on childminding premises.

*[DBS]: Disclosure and Barring Service

Being a childminder is ‘regulated activity’, which means people barred from working with children can’t do this role.

For childminders you can get:

  • an enhanced check
  • a children’s barred list check

People who live or work with the childminder

You can also request these checks for anyone 16 or over who lives with a childminder or works on childminding premises.

nodes.title: You'll have DBS checks done on you

body.content:
You'll have all of these checks done on you:

- an [enhanced check](/disclosure-barring-service-check)   
- a [children's barred list check](/disclosure-barring-service-check/dbs-barred-lists)   
- an [adults' barred list check](/disclosure-barring-service-check/dbs-barred-lists)   

^This role is 'regulated activity', which means you can't do this role if you're barred from working with adults receiving health or social care.^

Your employer will usually do the checks.

Find out [how to get these checks done](/disclosure-barring-service-check) if you're an employer.

nodes.title: You can request an enhanced check

body.content:
If the role is for someone working in a care home who doesn't provide health care (eg a cleaner or receptionist) you can request an [enhanced check](/disclosure-barring-service-check). 

##Health professionals working in care homes
For health professionals working in care homes (eg doctors or nurses) you can get: 

+ an [enhanced check](/disclosure-barring-service-check)
+ a [barred list check](/disclosure-barring-service-check/dbs-barred-lists)

This is a ‘regulated activity’ role. [Regulated activity](/government/publications/dbs-check-eligible-positions-guidance) is work that can’t be done by people barred from working with adults receiving health or social care.

If the role is for someone working in a care home who doesn’t provide health care (eg a cleaner or receptionist) you can request an enhanced check.

Health professionals working in care homes

For health professionals working in care homes (eg doctors or nurses) you can get:

  • an enhanced check
  • a barred list check

This is a ‘regulated activity’ role. Regulated activity is work that can’t be done by people barred from working with adults receiving health or social care.
